title: zasad@
author: zasad@
content: I welcome all participants of the crypto community!I took this idea from the members of the forum: tvplus006 and RatimovI thought for a long time whether to write this post or not, and took a break to make this post as useful as possible for beginners and for other forum participants.These 100 days on the forum took me more than 4 years.During this time I became DT1 and received a number of other meritsAll my works: translations, articles, guides, observations can be found in this topic:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5235612I am also an active member of The Alliance Of Bitcointalk Translators community, which helps disseminate useful content on the forum:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5442314.0There are a lot of useful topics on the forum where you can learn. Never, and 100 times more, never stop gaining knowledge. Technologies in this area are developing very quickly, and if you want to be a successful investor, you need to participate in discussions and exchange experiences with other members of the crypto community.I began to be interested in cryptocurrencies much earlier than I registered on the forum and I saw many stories where people quickly earned a lot of money and just as easily lost it, because they did not have enough knowledge to properly manage cryptocurrencies and invest them correctly.Don't be afraid to ask questions on the forum, I have seen situations many times when people are interested in a topic only after they have lost money."History teaches us that history teaches us nothing" (C)I am ready to confirm these words both from my own experience, when I lost part of my investments, and from the experience of my other colleagues.There are a lot of experienced specialists on the forum who will help you not make a lot of mistakes.I wish you success in your endeavors. If you take risks, then do it correctly, maintaining your risk management. And don't forget about this community if you become very rich.Best regards!

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Congratulations sir for your stayed over here though was thinking is your forum birthday, I mean birthday is the day you signed up here. Most times when I come across profile like this I kept asking myself questions that why didn't I discovered here earlier than this or why someone didn't hint me about this forum maybe I could have became more knowledgeable than this or probably be among those who bought some popular coin that are well known in the cmc today. Well lemme not go further into detail because no time is too late rather it's better to start than not starting at all. Congratulations on your stayed over here and I wish you long lasting towards your adventures. I know all your good works are greatly valued in one way or the other.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: My 100 days on Bitcointalk supposed to be on reputation board, I do not know why moderators left them all on meta board. Meta should be what are related to this forum, it should not be what are related to individual. My ranking, my 100 days on Bitcointalk, my 5000 merits and all things like that supposed to be in reputation board. I have known you since you open a thread and interview Bitcointalk members. You have been very active on many bitcoin boards and altcoin boards and I think on Russian local board. You are a good poster that newbies can emulate. Happy 100 days on Bitcointalk.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: There is a meme: Obama is giving medal to Obama.Let's give zasad@ medal to zasad@.History did not teach you anything at all 😂This should be in the reputation board and there is a dedicated topic for this type of celebration. While I don't mind the second suggestion not to follow but the first suggestion of moving it to the reputation board is no brainer.Quote from: _act_ on October 14, 2023, 02:01:53 PMMy 100 days on Bitcointalk supposed to be on reputation board64 seconds faster than me LOL

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: I'm only 39 days in despite being here in 2017, it's obviously going to take me another 100 days on the forum. But congratulations to you for 100 days with over 4 years, that's a lot of time you have contributed.Easy loss is easy to get in crypto it becomes common now we how to manage with risk management, but I now prefer HODL for the long term.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Congratulations zazad@, you're now a centurion.Time does fly when logged into this damn forum and eventually it grows on you enough to form part of your routine. I also just recently joined the 100 day mark, but didn't notice till I read your thread;I joined almost a year before you did and have enjoyed every bit of the forum spent since then and more so I have enjoyed the gift of Bitcoin which I learned about around the same time I registered an account here.Cheers to another 100.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.created_time: October 14, 2023, 02:29:41 PMLast edit: October 14, 2023, 02:41:14 PM by Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on October 14, 2023, 02:01:53 PMMy 100 days on Bitcointalk supposed to be on reputation board, I do not know why moderators left them all on meta board.Yes, you're right. This isn't the right board for all that.

comments.author: HelliumZ
comments.body: Congratulations @zazad for doing forum passing time century 100 ...But I'm now opening my bat in forum tournament...I just passed 2 days ...

comments.author: zasad@
comments.body: Thank you all for your congratulations!My colleagues posted these threads on Meta and I did the same.I wanted to share my thoughts after spending so much time here. Almost 25 days every year I was with you. Support each other and be more positive.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I looked at your registration date; you came a year later than me. But I compared it with mine, and then the thought came to me that I was living on a forum. Total time logged in: 315 days Congratulations. Keep being active; it's always helpful.

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: Enduring 100th day on the forum is truly a record. I may not have been able to spend as much time as you but I also wanted to spend my 100th day inspired by you.However congratulations 🎉 . Celebrating your 100th day is truly a joy and inspiration. Hope you give us something better in the coming days.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: ^ Let's see how much I got in my 6 years of bitcointalk forum journey.Oops, I missed my 100th, 200, and 300-day anniversary on bitcointalk. @zasad, congratulations on the milestone you achieved but I guess you need to spend a lot more time catching up on the numbers game.

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: Congratulations on 100 days of bitcointalk forum login with a long time, you here do a very great job giving a lot of things especially in the topic you made about the interview, but I haven't done it yet. Quote from: zasad@ on October 14, 2023, 01:44:25 PMThere are a lot of experienced specialists on the forum who will help you not make a lot of mistakes.I will not get lost in the forum if there are many experienced forum experts and I myself will continue to learn many things here.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: zasad@ on October 14, 2023, 01:44:25 PMI thought for a long time whether to write this post or not, and took a break to make this post as useful as possible for beginners and for other forum participants.It is definitely worth of writing as many low ranking members could pick an inspiration from your posts and also longevity. Your contribution to the forum and most especially the Russian local board has been immense, I celebrated you on spending hundred days here, and hopefully we will be celebrating another hundred days of you here. Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on October 14, 2023, 03:02:18 PMI looked at your registration date; you came a year later than me. But I compared it with mine, and then the thought came to me that I was living on a forum. Total time logged in: 315 days You shouldn’t be surprised because both prosecutors and security agencies normally do not have time for rest most especially when there are law breakers every single day

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: zasad@ on October 14, 2023, 03:02:01 PMThank you all for your congratulations!My colleagues posted these threads on Meta and I did the same.I wanted to share my thoughts after spending so much time here. Almost 25 days every year I was with you. Support each other and be more positive.My bad! In my bid to quickly edit what I posted earlier I forgot to say what should've been utmost at this time – Congratulations, zasad! Continue to be healthy and active (both here & in bed) 😏.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Congratulations on this. A journey of a thousand miles begins with a step and I'm glad I was able to have benefitted from your knowledge. Your input to the forum is invaluable and I'm sure you must have had setbacks back in your day but you still strove on. This a lesson in consistency and determination for not just newbies but other ranks as well. Keep up the good work@zasad!!

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: You're one hell of a motivator in this Forum, right from the first day I get to see how you make things happen (in terms of posting and otherwise) I just say to myself that you're one of the best.And I'll still say it that you're one of the best traders I have seen in this Forum, you're one of those top rank members who knows how to coordinate things to fall in line in this Forum, your work speaks for you...  Congratulations to you Mr ZASAD

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Congratulations manIt's not easy, at least I have only been here for 72 days in total since 2016 maybe I think this depends on how active we are in the forum. Anyone who is always active can have higher days if so there's no way someone who signed up lately would have a higher days. I have actually came across most of your post and they are very educative I must say and your input to this forum is also recommendable.

comments.author: Jessie2121
comments.body: Congrat to you zasad, more grease to your elbow.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: It took me 2 years for the first 100 days of my stay on the forum, the second 100 days took almost 4 years. I'm already wondering how many years it will take to add the next 100 days of being on the forum.zasad@ congratulations on the first peculiar anniversary, the next 100 days will definitely bring new knowledge, which you will share here on the forum.
